comments.author: batmanFAN07

comments.text:
+batmanFAN07
I like the TT because it is the literal turning point for many of the 
characters. Aragorn realizes the man he must be. Theoden relinquishes his 
stubbornness and acknowledges the better man. Faramir makes the choice that 
his brother never could.
Smeagol starts to sow seeds of doubt between Frodo and Sam.

The battle scenes in the TT carried a lot of weight even though the RoTK 
had bigger and more expansive fights. I liked the novelty of the unbeatable 
Ghost army, but that, coupled with the Eagles, was too much of a deus ex 
machina. It still didn't bother me too much in terms of enjoyment. It was 
more comical than anything to me, but I still liked it.

The movies never really explain the Eagles that well. They were meant as a 
literal deus ex machina in the books with some explanation. It didn't 
really mesh well in the Hobbit movies.
comments.author: luf4rall

comments.text:
+luf4rall the LOTR trilogy blows the hobbit trilogy out of the water, but i 
still enjoyed them. My favorite is still return of the king because it 
completes it all. Two Towers will always have the best battle scene though, 
the battle of helms deep is legendary and so hype, but i prefer ROTK 
because every problem is solved and every character has changed 
tremendously since the fellowship was formed. It's all personal preference 
though so i can understand why you like two towers better.
comments.author: batmanFAN07

comments.text:
how did the hobbit trilogy compare to the lotr movies to you? I think the 
Two Towers is probably my favorite movie of all time, and the RoTK is the 
lesser of the three.
